Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town and the initial romantic and personal conflicts among the characters.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Scene and Initial Conflicts
sub_scenes.description: The scene is set in a saloon, establishing the Ghost Town atmosphere and introducing initial dialogues and conflicts between characters.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Scene Setting
The Blonde Woman's Explanation
Conversation Continues - Man's Response and Old Timers' Wisdom

Major_Arcs.title: Arrival of Modernity and Threat to Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the modern surveyors and their plan to build an airport, posing an existential threat to Ghost Town and its inhabitants, contrasting with the cowboy's nostalgia.

sub_scenes.title: Cowboy's Lament and Modern Arrival
sub_scenes.description: A cowboy reflects on the past glory of Ghost Town as modern surveyors arrive with plans to demolish it, creating a clash between past and future.

narrative_arcs.title: Cowboy's Farewell and Nostalgic Reflection
Modern Arrival and Ghost Town Observation
Airport Plan and Town Demolition Imminent
Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town's Destruction

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Relationship Amidst External Turmoil
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the relationship drama between Nan and Cal, intertwined with the backdrop of the Ghost Town's impending demolition and Nan's family dynamics.

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Argument and Nan's Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal argue, followed by Nan's internal reflection on their past relationship and emotional distress over the Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Accusation and Cal's Defense
Woman's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal
Ghost Town Demolition and Woman's Outburst

sub_scenes.title: Business and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about cattle and the airport lead to conflict between Nan and her father over horses for construction.

narrative_arcs.title: Cattle Shipping and Airport Business Discussion
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance and Nan's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Nan is reassured about Cal's love by her family but decides to seek clarity herself, leading to a chase after Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance of Cal's Love
Nan's Resolve to Seek Clarity
Chasing Cal
Horse Business Interruption
Business Deal and Commitment

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal have a heated discussion leading to Cal's departure and Nan's emotional reaction, followed by a time skip and Cal's return.

narrative_arcs.title: Intense Conversation and Impending Departure
Cal's Departure
Reaction to Departing Horses
Time Skip and Nan's Longing Narration
Cal's Return and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Weather Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reunite amidst a severe snowstorm that threatens the livestock, shifting the narrative towards a crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Reunion and Unease in the Snow
Arrival at the Snowy Homestead and Weather Report
Concern Over Livestock and Fodder Shortage
Assessing the Snow's Severity and Nan's Concern
Narrative Description of Relentless Snowfall
Cal's Decisive Action to Save the Cattle

sub_scenes.title: Hope and Romantic Resolution Amidst Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Despair turns to hope with the arrival of a plane carrying fodder, leading to a romantic resolution between Nan and Cal amidst the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Despair and a Glimmer of Hope
Plane Arrives with Fodder
Hope and Romantic Reassurance

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Dynamics
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and the town of Cowtown, exploring reactions to his character and actions, and setting up conflicts involving Jeff and Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Showdown in Cowtown and Public Opinions
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson's dramatic action in Cowtown sparks varied opinions about his character, from admiration to dismissal.

narrative_arcs.title: Showdown and Reactions in Cowtown
Debate on Chane Benson's Character
Dismissive Reaction and Age Critique

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Confrontation with Sally
sub_scenes.description: Sally worries about Jeff's fascination with guns, leading to a confrontation and Jeff's admiration for Clyde Surratt.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood
Gun Obsession Critique
Confrontation over Gun Cleaning
Lectures and Disobedience
Plea for Decency
Clyde Surratt Admiration
Boasting and Challenge to Clyde Surratt
Violent Threat and Laughter

sub_scenes.title: Sally and Pete's Plan for Jeff and Shane Benson's Introduction
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Pete decide to help Jeff and Sally introduces Mr. Benson, leading to unsettling narrative reflection on Shane Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Planning to Help Jeff
Reaffirming Love and Duty Towards Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Sarcastic Remark
Narrative Reflection on Shane Benson's Demeanor

sub_scenes.title: Article Controversy and Benson's Reaction
sub_scenes.description: Controversy arises over an article by Clyde criticizing Chane Benson, leading to Sally's fear and Benson's unexpected reaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article
Sally's Fear and Clyde's Reassurance
Benson's Confrontation and Justification for Staying

sub_scenes.title: Debate and Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Surrett debate Benson's character and decide to invite him for dinner to understand him better.

narrative_arcs.title: Benson Justifies His Stance and Criticizes Clyde
Sally and Surrett Discuss Clyde's Article and Benson's Impact
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Discussing Chane's Skills and Dinner Invitation

sub_scenes.title: Dinner and Jealous Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Dinner with Chane Benson is interrupted by Jeff's jealous outburst and aggressive behavior towards Sally.

narrative_arcs.title: Polite Conversation and Departure for Moonlight Walk
Jeff's Jealous Confrontation
Escalating Aggression and Unwanted Kiss
Sally's Angry Retort and Accusations

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath of Confrontation and Ride to Town
sub_scenes.description: The aftermath of Jeff's assault leads to Chane's retaliation and Sally and Jeff's urgent ride to town to save Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Kiss Conversation and Jeff's Justification
Chane's Retaliation and Threat, Sally's Urgent Plea
Desperate Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation Inside the Newspaper Office

sub_scenes.title: Resolution of Benson Conflict and Newspaper Partnership
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation with Chane Benson resolves, leading to a new partnership at the newspaper and Sally's reflection.

narrative_arcs.title: Benson's Challenge and Chane's Departure with Clyde
Anxious Wait and Sally's Regret
Headline Change Order
Newspaper Partnership and Sally's Pride

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Ranch Romance and Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Betsy and Steve, their developing romance amidst ranch troubles and external threats, culminating in a romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Steve and Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss and the initial signs of trouble on Betsy's ranch, creating tension and setting up conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Gender Insult
Introduction of Steve Daley as the Boss
Discussion of Trouble with the New Boss

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Unease and Ranch Suspicions
sub_scenes.description: Betsy's initial unease with Steve grows alongside concerns about ranch troubles and suspicions about Double K.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Interaction and Betsy's Unease with Steve
Ranch Troubles and Suspicions of Double K
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Betsy

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Bar Fight
sub_scenes.description: Betsy faces confrontation in town, while a separate bar fight scene unfolds, adding to the Western setting's tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges at the Store
Bar Fight and Aftermath

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Decision and Romantic Confession
sub_scenes.description: Betsy initially decides to fire Steve but changes her mind, leading to a romantic confession and development in their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Realization about Steve and Ranch Decision
Betsy's Change of Heart and Hank's Suggestion
Betsy's Confession to Steve

sub_scenes.title: Negotiation and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve negotiate their relationship terms, leading to a love confession and Steve's decision to give up his gun for Betsy.

narrative_arcs.title: Negotiating Terms and Gunfighter Identity
Love Confession and a Difficult Request
The Ultimate Proof of Love and a Kiss

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Snowstorm Resolution
sub_scenes.description: A ranch confrontation escalates, but the narrative shifts to a snowstorm crisis resolved by air-dropped fodder, paralleling the earlier Ghost Town snowstorm.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Demands at the Ranch
Escalating Threats and Betsy's Firm Stance
Reflection on Violence and Foreshadowing of Attack

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass Showdown and Romantic Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the escalating conflict leading to Devil's Pass, a violent confrontation, and ultimately a romantic resolution for Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Desperate Measures and Ride to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's desperate attempts to resolve the ranch conflict lead to a ride towards Devil's Pass, anticipating a showdown.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Plea and Hank's Determination
Desperate Plea and Steve's Resolve
Betsy's Contemplation and Impending Action
Ride to Devil's Pass and Ceasefire

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Shooting
sub_scenes.description: Arrival at Devil's Pass leads to a violent confrontation where Steve is shot, followed by Betsy's emotional reaction and reunion with Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation
Capture, Debate, and Shooting of Steve
Betsy's Faint and Reunion with Steve
Relief and Reflection on Survival
Romantic Declaration and Future Together

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred - Love Triangle and Business
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the complex love triangle between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, intertwined with business dealings and misunderstandings, leading to romantic resolution for Carrie and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Dave's Sulking and Flashback to Ranch Trouble
sub_scenes.description: Dave sulks while Carrie recalls a flashback about ranch troubles concerning a new fence and range disputes.

narrative_arcs.title: Dave's Sulking and Rebuke
Flashback to Curley's Arrival at the Corral
News of Fencing and Range Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Fence Line Confrontation and Curley's Intervention
sub_scenes.description: Ranchers confront fence builders, escalating tension until Curley intervenes to prevent violence and expel Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranchers Discuss the New Fence
Confrontation at the Fence Line
Planning to Secure the Herd
Escalating Tension with Fred Gordon
Curley Intervenes to Prevent Violence
Disarming and Expulsion of Fred Gordon and Brother
Aftermath and Assertion of Ranch Ownership

sub_scenes.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings and Fred's Interruption
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave discuss their feelings, complicated by Carrie's attraction to Fred, who suddenly interrupts their conversation.

narrative_arcs.title: Reluctant Friendship and Brotherly Disdain
Defense of Fred's Actions and Implicit Feelings
Confession of Conflicted Feelings
Seeking Honesty and Deeper Conversation
Affirmation of the Current Relationship
Internal Monologue of Perceived Unspoken Love
Sudden Interruption and Confrontational Inquiry
Accusation and Defensive Stance

sub_scenes.title: Resolution of Love Triangle and Engagement
sub_scenes.description: Confrontation between Carrie and Fred resolves into a confession of love and a marriage proposal, while Dave reconciles with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Attempt to De-escalate and Initial Refusal
Accusation of Heartbreak and Questioning Conclusions
Declaration of Possessiveness and Protectiveness
Confession of Love Trigger and Reassurance
Brotherly Reconciliation and Movie Invitation
Flashback of Budding Romance and Anticipation
Marriage Proposal and Acceptance

sub_scenes.title: Business vs. Romance and Carrie's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Fred's focus shifts back to business, causing a rift with Carrie who feels deceived and decides to leave the West.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Misinterpretation Regarding Dave's Feelings
Clarification of Misunderstanding and Business Motives
Revelation of Selfishness and Business Priority
Angry Accusation of Deception and Trickery
Desperate Plea and Rejection of Affection
Internal Reflection on Suspicion and Motivation
Confrontation and Inquiry about Intentions

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Confrontation and Carrie's Emotional Breakdown
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Mr. Carlton, leading to emotional vulnerability and comfort from Dave, but ultimately reinforcing her decision to leave.

narrative_arcs.title: Anticipation and Impatience Before Confrontation
Direct Confrontation with Mr. Carlton
Accusation of Trickery and Business Betrayal
Defiant Assertion of Independence and Self-Reliance
Emotional Aftermath and Reflection of Foolishness
Reconciliation and Comfort in Affection

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Farewell and Finality
sub_scenes.description: Carrie expresses her decision to leave the West, despite lingering feelings for Fred, and has a final conversation with Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Relief and Lingering Pain After Decision
Distant Reunion in Town After Weeks Apart
Inquiry and Confirmation of Love
Riding Back and Discussing Past and Present Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Conflict and Chris's Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the conflict between Dirk and Rance, Dirk's escape, and Chris and Rance's romantic resolution amidst the turmoil.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injury and Rance's Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Dirk is injured, and Rance is in pursuit, setting up a tense chase and confrontation between the brothers.

narrative_arcs.title: Bedroom Interruption and Urgent Summons
Discovery of Gunshot Wound and Reassurance
Discussion about Dirk's Fight and Empty Gun
Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Ranch Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Rance, as Marshal, confronts Dirk, leading to a shooting and a moral dilemma about the injured Marshal's fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Man and Introduction of Dirk's Situation
Debate on Duty, Justice, and Decision to Stay for Dirk
Escape and Pursuit Begins
Failed Evasion and Pursuit Persistence
Confrontation, Shooting, and Aid
Disagreement on Fate of the Marshal

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Love Confession, and Rance's Recovery
sub_scenes.description: Dirk escapes while confessing his love for Rance, who recovers and reconciles with Chris, leading to a marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Departure and Difficult Decision
Confession of Love and Understanding
Rance's Defiance and Acceptance of Escape
Rance's Awakening and Father's Relief
Doctor's Inquiry and Father's Explanation
Confession and Proposal
Romantic Reconciliation after Argument
Urgent Plea to Rescue Dirk
Contemplating Rescue Strategy and Legal Implications

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Dirk's Dramatic Interruption
sub_scenes.description: Wedding day arrives, but Dirk's dramatic interruption leads to his capture and the revelation of his backstory, resolving the Dirk subplot.

narrative_arcs.title: Mary and Chris's Confessions and Fears
Wedding Day is Here, but Dirk is Missing
Dirk Interrupts the Wedding and Confrontation
Marshal's Plan, Dirk's Capture and Backstory Revealed
